<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>


<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Fellow Shareholders:</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger
achieved another outstanding year of performance for shareholders in 2013.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We are a company with many strengths, among them: </FONT></P>
<UL style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Strong and consistent returns to
  shareholders,<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>An aggressive strategic plan that delivers
  reliable growth and financial performance, and<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Deeply loyal customers who are the basis for our
  broad and growing market share.</FONT> </LI></UL>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Our Company&#146;s most enduring strength is our people &#151; our </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>more than 375,000 associates</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> who strive to make every customer&#146;s day a little better each time they
visit one of our stores. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Our foundational approach is called Customer 1<SUP>st</SUP>. It simply
means that the needs and wants of our customers are at the heart of every
decision we make&#151;in our stores, plants, offices, and facilities. It is our
associates who bring Customer 1<SUP>st </SUP>to life. From product and
technology innovation to improvements in the shopping experience, we are
inspired by the ever-changing needs and wants of customers. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Our greatest strategic advantage is our Customer
1</FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><SUP>st</SUP></FONT></B><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> culture</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We are proud to be both large and small. As one of the world&#146;s largest
retailers, we leverage economies of scale in ways that make a difference for our
customers in their daily lives. For example, we implemented an innovative,
faster checkout approach that saves minutes for each customer every time they
shop. We also leverage our size to offer great value on everyday items and
weekly specials, and then provide a personalized mobile app&#151;one of the most
popular in that crowded space&#151;that highlights the deals that match each
shopper&#146;s list. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>In this letter, I will provide more detail behind our outstanding results
in 2013 and explain the basis of our firm conviction that </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>there is much more to come</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
for shareholders, associates and customers. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Fiscal 2013 Results &#150; Delivering
Growth That Investors Can Count On</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>At our October 2012 investor meeting, we announced </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>aggressive growth plans</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
that expand our Customer 1<SUP>st</SUP> Strategy by accelerating growth in our
core business and improving our connection with all customers, expanding our
presence in new and existing markets, and investing to create unique competitive
positioning for today and the future. As a result, we expect to achieve a
long-term, net-earnings-per-diluted-share growth rate of 8-11% and an increasing
dividend over time.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We committed to four </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>key performance
indicators</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> to measure our progress at that
meeting as well: </FONT></P>
<UL style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Positive identical supermarket
  sales;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Slightly expanding FIFO operating margin on a
  rolling four quarters basis, excluding fuel;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Improving return on invested capital;
  and<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Growing market share.</FONT> </LI></UL>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>In 2013, the first full fiscal year executing our aggressive growth plan,
Kroger delivered on all four indicators. We achieved an unparalleled
41<SUP>st</SUP> consecutive quarter of positive identical supermarket sales;
expanded FIFO operating margin on a rolling four quarters and adjusted basis,
excluding fuel; improved return on invested capital, even as we increased
capital investments; and grew market share for the ninth consecutive year.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Kroger&#146;s </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>consistent and reliable
performance</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> delivers long-term
</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>growth investors can count on</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. And 2013 was another year of steady growth. Total sales were
$98.4 billion in fiscal 2013, an increase of 3.9% after adjusting for the
53<SUP>rd</SUP> week in fiscal 2012. Net earnings were $1.52 billion, or $2.90
per diluted share. On an adjusted basis, net earnings grew 13 percent over last
year&#146;s adjusted amount. We continue to lower Kroger&#146;s costs of doing business &#150;
achieving our ninth consecutive year of reducing operating expenses as a rate of
sales &#150; and to reinvest these savings in lower prices for our
customers.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">1</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT><STRONG>We are using free cash flow to reward
shareholders.</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> Since January 2000, Kroger
has returned nearly $10 billion to shareholders through share repurchases. Since
2006, Kroger has paid nearly $1.9 billion in dividends to shareholders, while
maintaining our investment-grade credit rating. In 2013, we increased our annual
dividend for the seventh consecutive year and returned more than $928 million to
shareholders through dividends and stock buybacks. If you had invested $100 in
Kroger stock on January 31, 2000, and reinvested all dividends issued, your
investment would have been worth $235 on January 31, 2014, and Kroger&#146;s Total
Shareholder Return in that same period is 125.8%. In March 2014, Kroger&#146;s Board
of Directors approved a $1 billion share repurchase program, underscoring our
commitment to deliver cash to shareholders.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Welcoming Harris Teeter to the
Kroger family</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>One of our platforms for growth is expanding into new markets. We are
proud and excited to </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>warmly welcome Harris
Teeter to the Kroger family of stores</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. We
completed our merger in January 2014 and integration is well underway. This
exceptional 54-year-old regional chain receives very high marks from their
customers for service, selection, meal-time solutions, and freshness. The 230
Harris Teeter stores are located in the highly attractive mid-Atlantic markets
and expand Kroger&#146;s national footprint. We have long respected the Harris Teeter
management team and their operations, and we look forward to bringing the best
of Harris Teeter and Kroger to our customers and shareholders. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Deeply loyal customers, creating
strong market share</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We have the privilege of serving </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>eight
million customers each day</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Every one of them
has unique interests and comes to our stores with the belief we will both meet
their needs &#150; their tastes, budget, and lifestyle &#150; </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>and</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> delight them with the
unexpected.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We continue to create innovative ways that allow us to know our customers
better than anyone else and to personalize their experience with us. We&#146;ve been
mining &#147;big data&#148; for a long time, always with the single focus on Customer
1<SUP>st</SUP> &#150; bringing to each customer what is most relevant to
them.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We have invested in price every year for ten consecutive years, saving
our customers more than $3 billion annually in the process. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We have rewarded customers with fuel savings through our popular fuel
rewards program at more than 1,240 convenient supermarket fuel center locations
in 2013. And, customers with a Kroger Rewards Visa credit card earned more than
$33 million in free groceries last year.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We have partnered with customers to support the community organizations
they care about most, returning $46 million annually to local organizations that
customers select through our Community Rewards program. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Our approach has resulted in growing both market share and share of
loyalty. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>And we are not done! </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT><STRONG>Customer 1</STRONG></FONT><STRONG><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><SUP>st</SUP></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> innovation
</FONT></STRONG><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>is giving us new and varied ways of
connecting with and deepening our relationship with our
customers.</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>We are growing our digital offering to deliver value to our customers
through the communication channels they prefer, and customers are responding. In
fact, our customers have downloaded more than 1 billion digital coupons since we
began offering them in late 2009. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We are innovating up and down our supply chain so that Kroger milk stays
fresher, longer in customers&#146; refrigerators. Through process improvements, our
dairy suppliers, milk plants, logistics operation, and stores worked together so
that we can promise our customers that </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger&#146;s milk is among the freshest in the industry</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>And we continue to build our </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>best-in-class Corporate Brands portfolio</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> by providing choices to our customers through a multi-tier offering of
price points and product experiences. We expect </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Simple Truth</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> and </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Simple Truth Organic</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> to
join our premium tier, </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Private
Selection</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, as a &#147;Billion Dollar Brand&#148; by the
end of fiscal 2014 as those brands are increasingly sought by shoppers focused
on natural and organic foods. Our </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Banner Brand
</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>continues to provide great quality with a
wide breadth of products, and our </FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Value</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> brand offers customers the
choice of quality products that are priced to fit their budget.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">2</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The Kroger Difference</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger&#146;s
culture and deeply-rooted values are also reflected in how we serve our friends
and neighbors in local communities, and how we take care of each other.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We strive to be connected to and responsive to the local communities we
serve by: </FONT></P>
<UL style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Delivering the equivalent of </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>more than 200 million meals </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>to more than 100 local Feeding America</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>food banks in 2013.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Engaging vendors and customers to donate
  </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>more than $6 million in 2013 in support of
  women&#146;s</FONT></B> <B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>health and breast cancer
  awareness programs</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Contributing </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>$3.3 million to the USO </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>in 2013 to
  help support the military and their families. Since</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2010, Kroger has donated $8.5 million to the USO &#150; the </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>largest cumulative gift to the USO </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>in that</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>organization&#146;s
  history.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Hiring more than 22,456 veterans since
  2009</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, and helping the &#147;100,000 Jobs
  Mission&#148; &#150; a coalition</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>of more than 130
  companies with the common goal of hiring more than 100,000 transitioning
  service</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>members and military veterans by 2020 &#150;
  surpass its original goal in January, seven years early.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Supporting more than </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>30,000 schools and local organizations </FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>with $46 million in 2013 through</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>our
  Community Rewards program that delivers personalized, customer-driven
  donations based on</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>total
  purchases.<BR>&nbsp;</FONT>
  </LI><LI><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Contributing an additional $9.1 million to local
  organizations in 2013 through The Kroger Co. Foundation.</FONT> <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>In the past five years, our foundation has donated nearly
  $40 million.</FONT> </LI></UL>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Let&#146;s remember that we make these investments because our customers tell
us these causes are important to them, and because they strengthen the
communities we call home. When you combine the cash, food and product we donate
to a variety of causes and programs, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Kroger
contributed more than $250 million to our local communities in
2013</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We also make a difference in the lives of our associates, customers and
communities through our commitments to safety, sustainability, supplier
diversity and job growth. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Kroger is </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>one of the safest companies
in our industry</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. Associate engagement in
innovative safety programs has reduced accident rates in our stores and
manufacturing plants by 77 percent since 1995. In 2013, 831 retail locations,
three manufacturing plants, and three distribution centers went the entire year
without a recordable accident.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>One of Kroger&#146;s key sustainability priorities is moving our retail stores
and facilities toward &#147;zero waste&#148;. Our stores are sending less waste to
landfills and incinerators through a variety of efforts, including composting
and our innovative </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Perishable Donations
Program</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; a process to rescue safe, edible
fresh products and donate them quickly to local food banks. This system has been
replicated by other retailers and today fresh products make up more than half of
the food distributed nationwide by Feeding America. Our manufacturing facilities
continue to lead waste reduction. Today, </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>26 of
our 38 manufacturing plants are designated as &#147;zero waste&#148;
facilities</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>You can learn more about our sustainability initiatives by reading our
annual sustainability report, available on our website
sustainability.kroger.com.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Kroger is a </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>leader in supplier
diversity</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>, spending nearly $2 billion
annually with women- and minority-owned businesses. We proudly remain a member
of the Billion Dollar Roundtable and the United States Hispanic Chamber of
Commerce Million Dollar Club.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Kroger is </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>doing our part to create jobs
and opportunity</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. We employ 7,000 more
associates today than we did last year, and nearly 90 percent of those new jobs
are in our supermarket divisions. Over the last six years, Kroger has created
more than 40,000 new jobs in the local communities we serve.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">3</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Leadership </FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We believe we have one of the strongest management teams in the retail
industry. For ten years our Company has been led by Dave Dillon, who has been
called &#147;the grocers&#146; grocer.&#148; Dave&#146;s knowledge of the business, passion for
customers and associates, and principled and disciplined approach to running a
world-class company has rewarded shareholders, associates, customers, and
communities. We thank him for the strong foundation he built and that we are
inspired to continue to expand. Dave often refers to retailing as a team sport.
Every great team, including ours, needs a great coach and leader. Thank you,
Dave, for ten remarkable years as Chairman and CEO.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>In Memoriam and
Retirements</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We were saddened by the loss of our friend and colleague, Jon C. Flora,
who passed away unexpectedly in September 2013. He was president of Fry&#146;s Food
Stores in Arizona. Jon was a compassionate and hands-on leader. We all miss him
deeply. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>We extend our appreciation to John LaMacchia, who retired from Kroger&#146;s
Board of Directors in December 2013 after 24 years of service; to Paul Heldman,
executive vice president, secretary and general counsel, who retires in May
after 32 years of service; and to Robert &#147;Pete&#148; Williams, senior vice president,
who retires in May after 37 years with the Company. On behalf of our entire
Company, we thank each of these individuals for their service and
leadership.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Bright Future &#150; More to
Come</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Kroger&#146;s future is bright. We are differentiating our Company in the
crowded field of retailers in ways that lead to sustainable, reliable growth.
And there is a lot more to come for shareholders, associates and customers.
</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>On behalf of the entire Kroger family, we thank you for your continued
support and trust. </FONT></P>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders</FONT></B></P>
<P align=right><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Cincinnati, Ohio, May 14, 2014</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To All Shareholders of The Kroger
Co.:</FONT></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>You are
invited to our annual meeting of shareholders of The Kroger Co. which will be
held at the MUSIC HALL BALLROOM, MUSIC HALL, 1241 Elm Street, Cincinnati, Ohio
45202, on June 26, 2014, at 11 a.m., eastern time, for the following
purposes:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT size=2 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To elect thirteen
      directors for the ensuing year;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To consider and act
      upon a proposal to approve the 2014 Long-Term Incentive and Cash Bonus
      Plan;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>3.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To consider and act
      upon an advisory vote to approve executive compensation;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>4.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To consider and act
      upon a proposal to ratify the selection of independent registered public
      accountants for the year 2014;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>5.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To act upon two
      shareholder proposals, if properly presented at the annual meeting;
      and</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>6.</FONT></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top width="100%"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>To transact such other
      business as may properly be brought before the
  meeting;</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Holders of common shares of record at the close of business on April 29,
2014, will be entitled to notice of and to vote at the meeting.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Attendance</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Only shareholders and persons holding proxies from shareholders may
attend the meeting. </FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>If you are attending the
meeting, please bring the notice of the meeting that was separately mailed to
you or the top portion of your proxy card, either of which will serve as your
admission ticket.</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>YOUR MANAGEMENT DESIRES TO HAVE A LARGE NUMBER OF SHAREHOLDERS
REPRESENTED AT THE MEETING, IN PERSON OR BY PROXY. PLEASE VOTE YOUR PROXY
ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE INTERNET OR BY TELEPHONE. IF YOU HAVE ELECTED TO RECEIVE
PRINTED MATERIALS, YOU MAY SIGN AND DATE THE PROXY AND MAIL IT IN THE
SELF-ADDRESSED ENVELOPE PROVIDED. NO POSTAGE IS REQUIRED IF MAILED WITHIN THE
UNITED STATES.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>If you are unable to attend the annual meeting, you may listen to a live
webcast of the meeting, which will be accessible through our website,
ir.kroger.com, at 11 a.m., eastern time.</FONT></P>

<TABLE style="BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="10%" border=0>

      Directors,</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>

<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">6</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>
<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Proxy Statement</FONT></B></P>





<P STYLE="text-align: right"><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Cincinnati, Ohio, May 14, 2014</FONT></P>




<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>This Combined
Notice, Proxy Statement and Annual Report is being furnished to the shareholders
of The Kroger Co. in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of
Directors for use at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on June 26,
2014, at 11 a.m., eastern time, at the MUSIC HALL BALLROOM, MUSIC HALL, 1241 Elm
Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202 and at any adjournments thereof. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>The principal executive offices of The Kroger Co. are located at 1014
Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100. Our telephone number is 513-762-4000.
This Proxy Statement and Annual Report, and the accompanying proxy, were first
furnished to shareholders on May 14, 2014.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Your proxy is solicited by the Board of Directors of The Kroger Co., and
the cost of solicitation will be borne by Kroger. We will reimburse banks,
brokers, nominees, and other fiduciaries for postage and reasonable expenses
incurred by them in forwarding the proxy material to their principals. Kroger
has retained D.F. King &amp; Co., Inc., 48 Wall Street, New York, New York, to
assist in the solicitation of proxies and will pay that firm a fee estimated at
present not to exceed $15,000. Proxies may be solicited personally, by
telephone, electronically via the Internet, or by mail.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>Robert D. Beyer, W. Rodney McMullen, and Ronald L. Sargent, all of whom
are Kroger directors, have been named members of the Proxy Committee.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>As of the close of business on April 29, 2014, the record date, our
outstanding voting securities consisted of 509,553,233 common shares, the
holders of which will be entitled to one vote per share at the annual meeting.
The shares represented by each proxy will be voted unless the proxy is revoked
before it is exercised. Revocation may be in writing to Kroger&#146;s Secretary, or
in person at the meeting, or by appointment of a subsequent proxy. Shareholders
may not cumulate votes in the election of directors.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>If you hold shares in street name and do not provide your broker with
specific voting instructions on proposals 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6, your broker does not
have the authority to vote on those proposals. This is generally referred to as
a &#147;broker non-vote.&#148; Proposal 4 is considered a routine matter and, therefore,
your broker may vote your shares according to your broker&#146;s discretion. The vote
required, including the effect of broker non-votes and abstentions for each of
the matters presented for shareholder vote, is set forth below.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 1, Election of Directors</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; An affirmative vote of the majority of the total number of votes cast
&#147;for&#148; or &#147;against&#148; a director nominee is required for the election of a director
in an uncontested election. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will
have no effect on this proposal.</FONT><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>
</FONT></B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>A majority of votes cast means that the
number of shares voted &#147;for&#148; a director nominee must exceed the number of votes
&#147;against&#148; such director.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 2, Approval of 2014 Long-Term Incentive and Cash Bonus
Plan &#150; </STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Approval by shareholders of the
Plan requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares entitled to vote on
the matter. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on
this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 3, Advisory Vote to Approve Executive
Compensation</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; Approval by shareholders
of executive compensation requires the affirmative vote of the majority of
shares entitled to vote on the matter. Accordingly, broker non-votes and
abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT><STRONG>Item No. 4, Selection of Auditors</STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2> &#150; Ratification by shareholders of the selection of independent public
accountants requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares entitled to
vote on the matter. Accordingly, abstentions will have no effect on this
proposal.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT size=3 face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT><STRONG>Item Nos. 5 and 6, Shareholder Proposals </STRONG></FONT><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>&#150; The affirmative vote of a majority of shares participating
in the voting on a shareholder proposal is required for its adoption. Proxies
will be voted AGAINST these proposals unless the Proxy Committee is otherwise
instructed on a proxy properly executed and returned. Broker non-votes and
abstentions will have no effect on these proposals.</FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">7</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>

<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><B>Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the
Shareholder Meeting to be Held on June 26, 2014. </B></FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT>Under the rules
adopted by the SEC, we are furnishing proxy materials to our shareholders
primarily on the Internet. We believe that this process should expedite
shareholders&#146; receipt of proxy materials, lower the cost of our annual meeting
and help to conserve natural resources. On or about May 14, 2014, we mailed to
each of our shareholders (other than those who previously requested electronic
or paper delivery), a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials
containing instructions on how to access and review the proxy materials on the
Internet and instructions on how to vote your shares. The Notice of Internet
Availability of Proxy Materials also contains instructions on how to receive a
paper or e-mail copy of the proxy materials. If you receive a Notice of Internet
Availability of Proxy Materials, you will not receive a printed copy of the
proxy materials unless you request one. If you receive paper copies of our proxy
materials, you may also view these materials at http://www.proxyvote.com. If you
receive paper copies of our proxy materials and wish to receive them by
electronic delivery in the future, please request electronic delivery at
http://www.proxyvote.com. </FONT></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman">8</FONT></B></P>
<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>


<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Proposals to Shareholders</FONT></B></P>

<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Election of Directors<BR>(Item No. 1)</FONT></B></P>




<P align=center><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2></FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The Board of Directors, as now authorized, consists of thirteen members.
All members are to be elected at the annual meeting to serve until the annual
meeting in 2015, or until their successors have been elected by the shareholders
or by the Board of Directors pursuant to Kroger&#146;s Regulations, and qualified.
Kroger&#146;s Articles of Incorporation provide that the vote required for election
of a director by the shareholders, except in a contested election or when
cumulative voting is in effect, will be the affirmative vote of a majority of
the votes cast for or against the election of a nominee.</FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT>The experience,
qualifications, attributes, and skills that led the Corporate Governance
Committee and the Board to conclude that the following individuals should serve
as directors are set forth opposite each individual&#146;s name. The committee
memberships stated below are those in effect as of the date of this proxy
statement. It is intended that, except to the extent that authority is withheld,
proxies by the Proxy Committee will be voted for the election of the following
persons:</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="15%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="66%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Professional</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="5%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="10%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Director</FONT></B></TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="15%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Name</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="66%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Occupation
      (1)</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="5%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Age</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=center width="10%"><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=1>Since</FONT></B></TD></TR>
  <TR style="LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt">
    <TD noWrap align=left width="15%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="1%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="66%"></TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="5%"></TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
    </TD>
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="10%"></TD></TR>
  <TR style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal">
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="99%" colSpan=7>
      <P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Nominees for Director for Terms of
      Office<BR>Continuing Until 2015</FONT></B></P></TD></TR>
  <TR style="LINE-HEIGHT: 10pt">
    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="99%" colSpan=7>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; PADDING-TOP: 2pt">
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="15%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Reuben V.
      Anderson</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="66%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Anderson is a
      Senior Partner in the Jackson, Mississippi office of Phelps Dunbar, a
      regional law firm based in New Orleans. Prior to joining this law firm, he
      was a justice of the Supreme Court of Mississippi. Mr. Anderson is
      currently serving as the lead director of AT&amp;T Inc., and during the
      past five years was a director of Trustmark Corporation. He is a member of
      the Corporate Governance and Public Responsibilities
Committees.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Anderson has
      extensive litigation experience, and he served as the first
      African-American Justice on the Mississippi Supreme Court. His knowledge
      and judgment gained through years of legal practice are of great value to
      the Board. In addition, as former Chairman of the Board of Trustees of
      Tougaloo College and a resident of Mississippi, he brings to the Board his
      insights into the African-American community and the southern region of
      the United States. Mr. Anderson has served on numerous board committees,
      including audit, public policy, finance, executive, and nominating
      committees.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=left width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="5%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>

      Committee, and our Lead Director.</FONT></P>

      qualifies him to serve as a member of the Financial Policy Committee.
      While at TCW, he also conceived and developed the firm&#146;s risk management
      infrastructure, an experience that is useful to the Kroger Board in
      performing its risk management oversight functions. His abilities and
      service as a director were recognized by his peers, who selected Mr. Beyer
      as an Outstanding Director in 2008 as part of the Outstanding Directors
      Program of the Financial Times. His strong insights into corporate
      governance form the foundation of his leadership role as Lead Director on
      the Board.</FONT></P></TD>

    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="66%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Dr. Phillips is
      Professor Emeritus of Finance at The George Washington University School
      of Business. She joined that university as a Professor and Dean in 1998.
      She retired as Dean of the School of Business as of June 30, 2010, and as
      Professor the following year. She was a member of the Board of Governors
      of the Federal Reserve System from December 1991 through June 1998. Before
      her Federal Reserve appointment, Dr. Phillips served as Vice President for
      Finance and University Services and Professor of Finance in The College of
      Business Administration at the University of Iowa from 1987 through 1991.
      She is a director of CBOE Holdings, Inc., State Farm Mutual Automobile
      Insurance Company, State Farm Life Insurance Company, State Farm Companies
      Foundation, National Futures Association, the Chicago Board Options
      Exchange, and Agnes Scott College. Dr. Phillips also was a trustee of the
      Financial Accounting Foundation until the end of 2010. She is a member of
      the Audit and Compensation Committees.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Dr. Phillips brings
      to the Board strong financial acumen, along with a deep understanding of,
      and involvement with, the relationship between corporations and the
      government. Her experience in academia brings a unique and diverse
      viewpoint to the deliberations of the Board. Dr. Phillips has been
      designated an Audit Committee financial expert.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="5%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>69</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="10%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=center><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>2003</FONT></P></TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="15%" ></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" ></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="66%" >&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" ></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="10%" ></TD></TR>
  <TR style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; PADDING-TOP: 2pt">
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="15%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Steven R.
      Rogel</FONT></B></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top align=center width="66%" bgColor=#c0c0c0>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Rogel was elected
      Chairman of the Board of Weyerhaeuser Company, a forest products company,
      in 1999 and was President and Chief Executive Officer and a director
      thereof from December 1997 to January 1, 2008 when he relinquished the
      role of President. He relinquished the CEO role in April of 2008 and
      retired as Chairman as of April 2009. Before that time Mr. Rogel was Chief
      Executive Officer, President and a director of Willamette Industries, Inc.
      He served as Chief Operating Officer of Willamette Industries, Inc. until
      October 1995 and, before that time, as an executive and group vice
      president for more than five years. Mr. Rogel is a director of Union
      Pacific Corporation and during the past five years was a director and
      non-executive Chairman of the Board of EnergySolutions, Inc. He is a
      member of the Corporate Governance and Financial Policy
      Committees.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Rogel has
      extensive experience in management of large corporations at all levels. He
      brings to the Board a unique perspective, having led a national supplier
      of paper products prior to his retirement. Mr. Rogel previously served as
      Kroger&#146;s Lead Director, and has served on compensation, finance, audit,
      and governance committees of other corporations.</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap align=center width="1%" bgColor=#c0c0c0></TD>

      services provider, where he has been employed since 1974. He was a member
      of the Board of Directors of Burlington Resources Inc. prior to its
      acquisition by ConocoPhillips in 2006. Mr. Runde serves as a Trustee

      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Runde brings to

      corporation.</FONT></P></TD>

      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Sargent is
      Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Staples, Inc., a consumer products
      retailer, where he has been employed since 1989. Prior to joining Staples,
      Mr. Sargent spent 10 years with Kroger in various positions. In addition
      to serving as a director of Staples, Mr. Sargent is a director of Five
      Below, Inc. During the past five years, he was a director of Mattel, Inc.
      and The Home Depot, Inc. Mr. Sargent is chair of the Audit Committee and a
      member of the Public Responsibilities Committee.</FONT></P>
      <P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Mr. Sargent has over
      30 years of retail experience, first with Kroger and then with increasing
      levels of responsibility and leadership at Staples, Inc. His efforts
      helped carve out a new market niche for the international retailer that he
      leads. His understanding of retail operations and consumer insights are of
      particular value to the Board. Mr. Sargent has been designated an Audit
      Committee financial expert.</FONT></P></TD>

<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always"></DIV><BR>

<P align=center><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Information Concerning the Board of Directors</FONT></B></P>



<P STYLE="text-align: left"><B><FONT style="FONT-VARIANT: small-caps" face="Times New Roman" size=2>Committees of the Board</FONT></B></P>



<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>The Board of Directors has a number of standing committees including
Audit, Compensation and Corporate Governance. All standing committees are
composed exclusively of independent directors. All Board committees have
charters that can be found on our corporate website at ir.kroger.com under
</FONT><I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>Guidelines on Issues of Corporate
Governance</FONT></I><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>. </FONT></P>
<P align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT>The table below
provides the current membership of our independent directors on each of the
standing committees of our Board of Directors.</FONT></P>

    <TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" noWrap width="3%" bgColor=#c0c0c0><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2>x</FONT></TD>
